urls.title: Cleaning Up with Michael Liebreich / Episode 31 - Emma Howard Boyd
urls.description: Emma Howard Boyd is one of the leading voices the UK‚Äôs Environment scene. As the Chair of the Environment Agency, she is at the forefront of the current environment agenda. This week, Michael and Emma will discuss everything from recent flooding in the UK to the unique UWC schooling experience.

text:
"The voice of being prepared for climate change and nature's recovery" - What is the role of the Environment Agency? @EmmaHowardBoyd, Chair of the @EnvAgency, explains it all to @MLiebreich

üéôÔ∏è Listen & watch now: https://t.co/2EFmNbo67J https://t.co/nBkY8fLCex

text: @WasteCrimeWatch @HMRCgovuk @EnvAgency I have been wondering what happened following that raid ever since I wrote about it.

@EnvAgency Typical of the EA- a few illegal nets is if no consequence- THE EA STEER CLEAR OF BIG POLLUTERS - THE EA ARE IMPOTENT AND PATHETIC. 122,000 tonnes of hazardous waste gets dumped and the EA do nothing. 

https://t.co/ww7zVAoiij

@farmerkaney @loosecollie @EnvAgency @DaveThroupEA @dredgetherivers But but but the environment. I must say keeping the water in the river has far more environmental benefits than flooding streets and sewage systems, think of all the polluting products that get dragged into a river when it overflows. #dredgerivers

@farmerkaney @loosecollie @EnvAgency @DaveThroupEA @dredgetherivers The EA forget that they used to be called the National Rivers Authority, tasked with maintaining rivers. You don't maintain something by neglecting it
Why does the UK export waste to Bulgaria? Surely we are pricing out local use of the available infrastructure? @EnvAgency https://t.co/X58eSMmv6Q
